page.title: 15Nether Stowey: Police
page.content: We have the only village police station this side of Bridgwater. It is manned by one constable. His police van carries radio communication and an initial breathalysing kit. On his person he has a pair of handcuffs and a truncheon. A policeman's uniform hasn't changed in style for 35 years . He is in daily contact with Taunton Police. They often require him to attend accidents. There is an accident on the A39 on average once a week. This area has very little crime. There are occasional burglaries and car thefts, also deer poaching on the hills. The village's biggest problem is vandalism of certain buildings. There have been two instances of glue sniffing and in recent years one of rape. In the 19th century the Rose and Crown often served as a court. Taunton County Court tries serious crimes.
